availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Alfred Lacey Hough (PA merchant, capt. 19th US Inf. chief commissary of musters for the army of the cumberland )

body.p: Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, merchant and soldier. New Jersey native. Son of Jonathan Hough and Jane Chapman Lacey Hough. Merchant in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, in 1850. Served in the 17th Pennsylvania Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a sergeant from April 18, 1861 to June 29, 1861. Served in the 19th United States Infantry Regiment as captain from May 14, 1861. Served as Chief Commissary of Musters for the Army of the Cumberland from July 1, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Pennsylvania, Philadelphia County, North Mulberry Ward, p. 421A.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), V.
Hough, Alfred Lacey, Soldier in the West: The Civil War Letters of Alfred Lacey Hough, ed. Robert G. Athearn (Pickle Partners Publishing, 2017).
Find A Grave, "Gen Alfred Lacey Hough (1826-1908)," Memorial #10656705, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/10656705 (accessed November 5, 2020).
KYR-0002-161-0031.
